      • clone

        public final Object clone()
                   throws CloneNotSupportedException
        Returns a deep copy of this object. This implementation is final because we do not obey the convention of calling super.clone(); subclasses could not rely, then, on the expected behavior: x.clone().getClass() == x.getClass(). This class does not implement Cloneable, because it is not ok for Object.clone() to perform a field-by-field copy (i.e. a shallow copy).
        Overrides:
        clone in class Object
        Returns:
        a deep copy of this object
        Throws:
        CloneNotSupportedException - if cloning is not supported
